Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2024049833.CaseDesc: Sheryl Rucci was last seen on August 9, 2005, shortly after 9 pm, at her residence in Lockport, New York, USA.

Tattoo: Unknown, A rose, Ashley on one ankle

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time at her residence in north Edmonton, Alberta. Later that day, Nadia’s abandon vehicle was discovered in some bushes down the side of a hill entering Rundle Park.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2014002344.CaseDesc: Bradley Verbeek was last seen in London, Ontario on December 8, 1987. His clothing and personal belongings were all left in a house where he was renting a room.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.

Case reference: 2014003922.CaseDesc: On Saturday July 15, 1972, Mr. Zukewhich and a friend took a canoe on to Clearwater Lake. Witnesses state that both men were under the influence of alcohol and that they took alcohol with them into the canoe. Witnesses further noted that the lake was extremely rough due to high winds. Mr. Zukewhich and friend were seen departing around 1600 hrs heading towards an area known as Long Point. A resident of Long Point advised police he observed one person in the red canoe which was sitting flat indicating weight in the front. The canoe was recovered on July 17th. Despite extensive searching, Mr. Zukewhich was never located.

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2022058884.CaseDesc:
Donna Williams was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on November 18, 2022 at the Women's Shelter. Donna lives a high risk lifestyle, is transient and has been known to travel between Alberta and British Columbia. 
Donna is also known to use false identification and provide false phone numbers and addresses to social care facilities and businesses.

Mark: Left Eye, Mole under left eye

Case reference: 2014005473.CaseDesc: Shayne Murray Robinson was last seen in Celista, British Columbia on July 23, 2010. On July 24, 2010 the vehicle that he drove was found abandoned near Barriere on Hwy 5, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003305.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1987, Wade Stanley Saxton was seen for the last time as he left his residence in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 2022042745.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2022, Roman Perelstein was last seen in the area of Bathurst Street and Orchard Heights Boulevard in the Town of Aurora, Ontario. Family and friends have not been able to contact him. This is reportedly out of character.

Teeth: Missing 4 upper teeth, has dental prosthesis

Case reference: 2014004549.CaseDesc: Anthony Wennekers was seen for the last time in July 2003, downtown Calgary, Alberta.  Anthony suffers from a mental disability and was leading a high risk lifestyle at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006010899.CaseDesc: Larry Zink left his home in Delavan, Wisconsin, USA. Family members have indicated that he may have been depressed.  In October 1995, Mr. Zink's vehicle was located unoccupied in a gravel pit 65 km north of Pickle Lake, Ontario.  Mr. Zink has not been seen since.

Teeth: False, Upper teeth and partial bottom teeth - front bottom teeth are his own

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. Jack may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2024042256.CaseDesc: Alexandr "Sasha" Puryga was reported missing on August 13, 2024 after failing to report for work in the vicinity of 7th Concession and 16th Sideroad in Vaughan, Ontario. His vehicle was subsequently located nearby, unoccupied. Given the circumstances, the police and Alexandr's family are concerned for his well-being, and his disappearance is being treated as suspicious.

Case reference: 2014004252.CaseDesc: Gordie Dixon was reported missing by his family on 19 March 1990 in Eden Valley, Alberta.  Gordie may have been seen on the Macleod Trail in Calgary, Alberta a few months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Engraved bracelet
Tattoo: Upper Back, Naked woman and atomic mushroom cloud

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2014001237.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of a well nourished man were found floating in Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park that is located in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had his natural teeth and had taken his own life.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006008399.CaseDesc: Joseph Niro last contacted his daughter by telephone on June 02, 1999. He was last seen on June 20, 1999.

Hair: Black, Long, Wavy, Parted to the right

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2014003434.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 18, 1986, Monique Brosseau was seen for the last time at her home in Duhamel-Ouest, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002284.CaseDesc: Richard Reitmeier has not been heard from or seen since the fall of 1988. There is not much known surrounding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2017074237.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the partial remains of an adult male were discovered in a wooded area off of Tower Road, south of the Town of Mactier, in Severn Township, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, Saskatchewan. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Anthony.

Tattoo: Skull with top hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bear

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2022006110.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2022, Steven Pinch was last seen in downtown area of Calgary, AB.  Steven is known to frequent the city of Red Deer, Alberta, and the town of Rocky Mountain House, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018063460.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1992, at approximately 8:30 am, Debra Kumar was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 2009004299.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1973, Madeleine Van Overdijk was reported missing by her husband.  She was last seen at her residence in Brantford, Ontario. Information reported to police suggested she was going to Toronto.  It is unknown if in fact she made it to Toronto.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2014004827.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2004, 41 year old Jacqueline "Jackie" Bob was last seen picking mushrooms in the Brittany Triangle of the Nemiah Valley.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born, raised and lived on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, Saskatchewan up until the time of his disappearance. His friends and family describe him as a very withdrawn individual. He left the colony the evening of September 18, 2011 on a tractor that was recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Benjamin has included numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2008003599.CaseDesc: Charlie Campbell was last seen November 6, 1988 in Red Lake Ontario.  It is believed that he drowned.

Case reference: 2006020499.CaseDesc: Theodore Piekarz was initially reported missing in 1978. Piekarz was planning a trip to British Columbia. He was seen at the Kirkland Lake Train Station in October 1986. Mr. Piekarz may suffer from mental health issues, including suicidal tendencies.

Mark: Nose, mole on the right side of his nose

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel (Paul) Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014003329.CaseDesc: Jan Rynberk was last seen leaving his residence in Welland, Ontario, on November 29, 1987. Jan's vehicle was located on December 1,1987, in a parking lot in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm, "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2011, Howard Graveline was reported missing from his home in the Limbour district in Gatineau, Quebec. Howard left his vehicle, passport and wallet behind. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2018046096.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2018, Victor Falk was seen for the last time after being dropped off at his residence in Rosthern, Saskatchewan. At the time of his disappearance, Victor suffered from Alzheimer's disease.

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: On November 26, 1988, Amber Potts was seen for the last time in Etobicoke, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was staying in a hotel room and was living a high-risk lifestyle. All her personal belongings were left in her hotel room.

Case reference: 2010000699.CaseDesc: William Ostertag last spoke to his brother on December 16, 1990.  He was reported missing when he failed to show up for his work Christmas party in North Bay.

Hair: Black, Short, Comb over, moustache, sideburns
Coat: May have been wearing a blue or grey coat

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2006008799.CaseDesc: Doris Fennell was last observed at the home of an acquaintace in Kitley-Elizabeth Township, near Addison, Ontario. Foul Play is strongly suspected in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bike in front of his family’s home in Etobicoke, Ontario. Later that evening, when Richard’s mother returned home, his bike was found at the house. Richard was a good child at home, and in school, and had no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2014001627.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1990, Robert Henson was seen for the last time riding his horse along the river in the Hummingbird Falls and Creek area in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta. While riding his horse, Robert was swept down the river.

Case reference: 2018061754.CaseDesc: Jessica Malouf-Pelletier left her parents' home in St.-Sulpice, Quebec, on an undetermined Friday evening in September 2017. Jessica was picked up in a dark vehicle driven by an unknown person and has not been seen since. She was only reported missing to the police in March 2018. Jessica was known for living a high-risk lifestyle and she had previously expressed her intent to relocate to Ontario and earn money.

Hair: Blonde, Blonde hair, sometimes dyed red

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On 13 March 2015, Misty Faith Potts of the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, located approximately 50 km west of Edmonton, Alberta, was last seen when she was left on the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2023033146.CaseDesc: Winston Seeseequon was last seen June 24, 2023, in the community of South Tallcree First Nation in Alberta.  Winston's clothes were located by the river.  Extensive searches of land, water and air proved negative.

Case reference: 2014002118.CaseDesc: Henry M’Lot was reported missing by his brother on November 13, 1973. At the time of his disappearance, he was despondent due to the separation with his wife.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Head, Burr hole from operation right front side of skull

Case reference: 2014003583.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratchford was last seen at a prospect site at Lake Geneva on October 28, 1974. He intended to walk to Highway 144 and catch a ride to Timmins; he was never seen again. Police investigation to date cannot rule out the possibility that Patrick has been a victim of foul play due to the duration of time since he went missing.

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005 in Nova Scotia. He was known as a regular client at the casino. Andy was travelling from Richmond, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2014004048.CaseDesc: Dwayne Allen Rideout was last seen on September 24, 1999 at the Generator Cabaret on 3rd Avenue in Prince George, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.
